metadata.name: Woman, Life, Freedom ✊ زن، زندگی، آزادی
metadata.description:
Inspired by the song "Baraye" meaning "for/because of", written by Shervin Hajipour (in Farsi) which has become the anthem of Iran's 2022 revolution. 
After the death of Mahsa Amini and the start of the protests, an Internet meme was spread through social media by which (through phrases starting with the word "for") Iranians explained their personal reasons for protesting and wishing for regime change in Iran.

"for dancing in the street  
for the fear of kissing  
for your sister, my sister, and ours  
for the changing of rotten minds and rotten powers  
for all the shame of being poor  
for all the yearning for something more  
for all the kids searching for their dreams  
for the lose-lose economy  
for all the poisoned air that we have to breathe  
for Valiasr Avenue's dying trees  
for all the Pirouz that may go extinct  
for all the dogs outlawed out in the streets  
for all the tears we cry and the endless grief  
for all the images that we can't unsee  
for a smile, for a smiling face  
for all the students, for a future that we can't replace  
for all the forced ideas of paradise  
for all the great ideas that will never rise  
for all the children that won't be saved  
for all the "for all the's" that won't be said  
for all the endless empty promises  
for all the falling of cheap houses  
for the feeling of a peaceful life  
for the Sun after a long dark night  
for all the pills we take cause we just can't sleep  
for man, country, rebuilding  
for all the girls that wish they could be man  
for Woman, Life, Freedom"
